interesting_fact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, although most of its population lives on just four main islands.
Germany is home to over 20,000 castles, including the famous Neuschwanstein Castle that inspired Disney's Sleeping Beauty castle.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country and is home to more kangaroos than people.
Kenya is known as the 'cradle of humanity,' where some of the oldest human fossils have been found.
India is the largest producer of spices in the world, exporting to over 150 countries.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting nearly 90 million tourists annually.
South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria (executive), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
Mexico City is sinking about 10 inches a year because it was built on top of an ancient lakebed.
